alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Nowata; Ottawa; Rogers (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 8:42PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CRAIG...NORTHEASTERN ROGERS... NORTHWESTERN DELAWARE...SOUTHWESTERN OTTAWA...NORTHERN MAYES AND SOUTHEASTERN NOWATA COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM CDT... At 841 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of Vinita to 3 miles southwest of Chelsea. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Vinita... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Chelsea... Salina... Fairland... Afton... Langley... Adair... Bernice... Ketchum... Foyil... Bluejacket... Wyandotte... Disney... Big Cabin... Pensacola... New Alluwe... Hoot Owl... Cherokee State Park... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 258 and 304. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.

area.areaDesc: Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Nowata; Ottawa; Rogers
